								This game.. I don't really know where to start.Do note this is a very short and straight to the point review. When i got it.	The game was enjoyable, i loved the survivalness. The maps seem very well done. At this point i was enjoying the game and would recommend it. After a while	I started to notice the developers were very slow on there updates which i had no problem with. However after some time they kept repeating the same thing.Animations over and over. I thought they were done. But that's not the only thing. They don't seem to put out a lot of content. (And yes im aware the developer team is small. And like i said i understand for the slowness. )So then i decided i wanted to make a map and which i did it is called South Wuxburg or West Wuxburg. It was pretty good to me and people seem to enjoy it. Until one day.  Bugs and how they handle it. (mini rant)I have found many bugs and glitches with this game and it's getting very annoying. And yes im aware this is a EARLY access game but it's been out for over 2 years now. However it broke my workshop item once, And now there is a bug that has completely broken my world editor i use to edit my items. i reinstalled and everything..Before that i had another issue with the editor. I put in a report and got nothing and still nothing of the date of this review.I put that bug report in  October 3rd 2016, It's November 21st. No one has bothered to look it at or even message me about it. There was also a few other bug reports that are there. No one has responsed.I'm just showing how they don't seem to pay attection to bug reports. I Don't hate this game for this it's just very annoying and frustrating and the only way to get them to see this is to make a review. OVERALLGet this game if you like zombie survival games, You will enjoy the mutiplayer (if that don't bug out like it sometimes for me). This game is pretty enjoyable even at 66.4 hours. You can build, Fight, Barrcade and do a bunch of other stuff like crafting.  However be prepared for bugs and to know that the developers might not respond to your bug report. (for a while) Co-op can be extremely fun when the port forwarding works (and it's not my issue). There's lots of modifers to change out how you want the world to be. Make it easy, make it hard, Make it extremely hard. Customize your person. Use the workshop and download many cool mods and maps. Do note  i do not hate these developers and i love there game.	Also, i thought we were getting creative mode. It has gone slient in the blog posts they do. Other then that. Have fun playing this game if you do get it and hopefully this review has helped you.I am however not recommending this game since i am very tired of being forgottion and the bad support. Also Thanks for breaking the map editor.

number of helpful: 13 of 22 people (59%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
12
Early Access Review
Everyone saying this game sucks or is dying or will never get completed because we don't have NPCs/Vehicles/Animations yet will always find something to complain about. Those things will get implemented and then they'll be screaming something new.I don't even remember when I picked up this game, but I figured my love for it is pretty set-in-stone so a review couldn't hurt. I am a die-hard zombie fan, so hearing zombie survival on a scale like Zomboid instantly pulled me in. Everything the Devs are trying to bring keep me here more. This game is a gem, and it should be looked at as such.The gameplay is phenomenal, but remember this is just my opinion. The experience is heightened with headphones to really pull you in to the world, but without it still remains a tense and exciting environment. The subtle fade of the smooth atmospheric music which dynamically changes with your setting really helps, be it surrounded by deadly zeds and hearing frantic violins or on a roof cooking over a campfire to a soft piano. I've found myself so immersed in the setting many times that I have to mentally step back and remember I'm playing a game.March 11th, 2017The main issue with current development is highly anticipated features are taking extra time to roll out after being teased not too long ago. Vehicles are getting good, promising attention at current time of writing. No sight of NPCs yet, but animations seem two shakes away from completion. My thought is animations and vehicles will have release dates around each other if not the same time, but that is probably best-case scenario.Pros- Immersive, well-designed world with developing storyline and random finds- Early access, so a lot can still happen (which takes time)- Complex building/crafting/cooking systems -- Build your survival base, or fortify existing structures. New metalworking has been added for increased defensive structures. Count your calories to maintain a healty diet in a dying world. (:- Character specialization -- Be a chef, lumberjack, thief, or more! Varying attribute points are given to really tweak your character's performance.Neutrals- Clunky combat -- Anything other than melee is questionable to me with low skills, and even that sometimes gets odd. (*see footnote for expansion on this)- I personally don't find the UI to be a nuisance, but I can understand players disliking it.- Early access, so a lot can still happen (which takes time)- I'll keep this one neutral as it bounces back and forth, but things can get arduous fast. Fortifying can turn into luring a horde away from base. Luring a horde away can turn into getting lost/hurt/off track. Simple things like going to get some food downstairs and now you've got a shattered shin. You'll understand when you play.Cons- Early access, so a lot can still happen (which takes time, and has). This is what holds up a lot of people from enjoying what you have, and instead focusing on what you don't have. Early development is going to be a rollercoaster, and things will get halted for reasons that won't always get explained clearly if at all. You have to understand this if you wish to assist in early development. I believe in this title, and I believe it could grow to be a massively entertaining experience for a lot of people.- There is a slight lack-of-life to the world (no pun intended). No abandoned vehicles littering the roads, not much in the way of saying "there was an outbreak and panic ensued" other than TV or radio broadcasts during initial infection. Devs are working on introducing more world-clutter like this, but more important features take the front seat.I could write an even longer post and say so much more but you should really just experience it for yourself.(*In all my hours of playing, I haven't played with the guns too much other than shotguns and pistols. I have no clue how the aiming and reloading skills work at high skill levels because I've never gotten there myself.)March 28th, 2017Reading over some other helpful reviews and I was reminded how old this Early Access is. Correct, but you must remember that we are not playing the same exact version we used to play. They reworked the entire system a year or so ago. Hell, they even increased the resolution of textures. If the game isn't fun to you as-is, it won't be fun to you when the damned NPCs/Anims/Vehicles get added because you won't enjoy the CORE game.We've got active updates on two of the three long-awaited mechanics and people are still flailing about, damning Zomboid to development hell. Vehicles are being polished, and Animations are pretty much complete, what else do you want? You want it on a silver platter, immediately. Don't choose Early Access if you can't wait patiently.

content:
, 2014
Early Access Review
								Early Access Review:For a game that's premise is over-saturated, Project Zomboid stands unique and fresh compared to it's peers. Project Zomboid isn't your typical zombie game nor your typical survival horror game. Project Zomboid is more of a simulator than an RPG. When playing, you'll get frustrated so many times before actually getting the hang of everything as for PZ is a roguelike, once your survivor dies, he/she is dead forever. No matter how far your progress or big your fortress. Many of which mistakes you'll make is mostly because you got too over your head, or just plain stupidity. But once you get how the game goes, you'll surely live to see another day, maybe months.To fully enjoy the game, one must stop looking at this game as a survival RPG, and more of a survival sim. With the word simulator being said, this means managing, scheduling and farming. Think of it as a mash-up of The Sims + Farmville + Old-School Zombies. You gather supplies and build a base of operations where you can store your supplies and gear or maybe start a farm for food supplies. You can also choose to be a nomad and move from place to place.Moreover on being a simulator, you have to take care of your survivors needs, hunger, boredom and health should be taken care of and maintained well regularly. You can't just sit all day and wait. As you build your base, the game adds a Farmville + Tower Defense vibe to it. Make sure though you don't go gathering supplies at night as it gets pretty dark and dangerous. With this scheduling is also important, make sure you make a to-do list for the day, patience pays in this game, some areas are so infested that you have to postpone your scheduled scanveging trip. Everything is important in this game, make sure to gather everything for maybe in the future you may need it. For an Early Access Game, Project Zomboid is already filled with hours and hours of fun gameplay, as everything in the main gameplay is there, surviving, scavenging, building. It is announced and on paper though that NPC's will be added to give the game a more immersive feel and dynamic events. I personally am looking forward for the NPC's, imagine with the amount of different kinds of gameplay all mashed together in one added with NPC's and dynamic events all together can put this game into another way crazier level.I totally recommend this game for everyone, especially for people who are up for a challenge.

content:
er 11, 2014
Early Access Review
								One of the best zombie games I have played.  Despite some short comings (which they are still working on) this game is just fanstastic! ProsRealism without going over the top like some zombie games.Combat is really enjoyable once you get the hang of it.Why more fun with friends and can PVP.Can play sandox and customize from rather easy zombies to "true zombies" as they call it.Can do cool stuff like use a rope (or make one from sheet) to climb out a window if the house gets flooded with zombies.One of the best inventory system ever. (IMO) MIght take a bit getting used to but just make sense in terms of reaslism.ConsBecoming sick from zombie bite or sratch can be OP at times (like after 25 days and like 700 zombie kills one just scratches me and its game over.)  but as I pointed out you can changed that in sandbox if you dont like it.Missing stuff like cars (imo)Lack of other things to do such as more crafting like modding weapons more then just nailed bat and sawed off. Lack of firearm types (only pistol, shutgun, and varrmint rifle at the moment) I would like to see a couple types of each and even assault rifles SMGs, sniper rifles, you know. No in game map (like I cant find a map of my local area map at every gas station or store) but you can find one online. Most of the stuff in Cons are all stuff that very well will be fixed by full release, but as of now they are cons.  All in all I give this a 8 out of 10 which is damn good considering its still "early access".

content:
ber 7, 2014
Early Access Review
								The game is an excellent simulator for anybody who doesn't mind a bit of hardcore permadeath. If you die in this game, it's game over. No second chances, no revivals. Straight back to the main menu. The game does a very good job of handling the things you would feel in a zombie apocolypse. Stress, Lack of sleep, Pain, Panic, the full monty. It uses a rather unique "Moodles" system. It has different tiers of emotions that you go through, for instance anxiety, onto stress, onto extreme stress, onto terrified. The game has it's problems. For example they use both a number system and a moodles system and it gets confusing. I don't mind the moodles system, in fact I admire the originality but I would say make the number stats system visible too.On the whole I really appreciate the game, it has brilliant developers, posting the oh-so amazing mondoids and with a sense of humor anyone'd die for.  Keep up the good work, dev team if you're reading this, and if you're thinking of buying the game, I say go for it as long as you don't mind a bit of hardcore. It has LOADS to do to keep you busy and theres constantly new features as well as the option to go back to the previous build. The price is great too, it's nice and compact and the animation is pretty darn good. Thanks for reading, Ickleslimer.

content:
er 25, 2013
Early Access Review
								This is possibly the best experience you will have with a post-apocalyspe genre. This game has so many features in its early version. There are hundreds of different items and foods. Tools, weapons, and materials can be used to create entire buildings up to several stories tall. There is a simple crafting system allowing you to use improvised weapons and tools as well. Carpentry, farming and cooking all of in-depth systems and recipes to get what you want and need to survive more successfully than your predecessors. You can get trapped on the second story of a building and be trapped by a ravenous horde controlling the first floor. You can choose to risk your health and life to jump out the window and make your dashing escape with or without injury...or you can rip off the curtains and tie them into a rope stable enough to lower yourself down and out of the infested building. Scavenging a local house you can open a closet to find a zombie who then rushes you and sinks his teeth into your neck. Even if you destroy him and survive you only have mere hours, possibly days before you turn. All this and more is in this game currently but don't be fooled. This is NOT a complete and perfect game. Several in-game items have no purpose even when they look useful and several items and weapons have placeholder icons or textures. Planned and promised features are aplenty such as vehicles and NPCs. This is a small developement team and will take its time making this game even greater than it already is turning out to be, be patient and you'll get a survival experience like no other.

Early Access Review
								Has potential, but is a bit unforgiving with fiddly controls at the moment. There's also graphical slowdowns, but that's to be expected from an un-optimised alpha.Currently it feels like a game that needs you to play whilst having the wiki open on another screen. It's unclear as to how cooking works for example, and systems overall rely on an awful lot of trial and error, something you don't really have a lot of time for.Controls are also a bit awkward at the moment too, feeling unresponsive and arbitrary.But the potential is huge. I don't think there's a zombie survival sim out there with as much depth as this one's attempting.

content:
y 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								A zombie survival game that truly simulates a real zombie apocalypse without being mundane like other games. Pros-Hunger and thirst system that is deeper than most (Calories and fats)-Smart AI-Meaningful updates-Weekly Devblogs -Working multiplayer-Big variety of foods-Intricate food system-Deep character creation-Nice soundtrack-World is filled with lots of things to interact with (Trees to harvest for wood, foraging in the forest for berries, etc.)-Lots of things to do (Barricade safehouse, kill zombies to reduce the risk of an attack)Cons-Some items don't have a dedicated model, but they are already working on it for the next update-No npcs yet, since they would complete the game. (They are also working on this as well)-No cars yet (This as well)Overall this is my all time favorite zombie game. This game actually gives you loads of choices on how to survive. You actually need to secure a safehouse and then make sure zombies or bandits can't break in. You actually need to make sure your food is in a safe place or else it will rot. There are lots of things that relate to real life which is what makes this game so fun.

content:
er 30, 2013
Early Access Review
								This is a great game, especially considering that its still in Alpha!  There are still a lot of bugs and it runs slowly and crashes at times but it is reletively playable in it's current state. As long as you are prepared to cope with these I'd deffinitely recommend buying this game in Alpha or at least trying out the demo if you're unsure.Some areas I hope they work on or prioritise in future releases/fixes;- Improve controls and sneaking machanic (currently sneaking doesn't seem to work well).  It would be great to be able to hide as well (maybe in some containers like bins or wardrobes).- It would be nice to see even more weapons, features and items you can create in later releases.- While most of the music is excellent I also hope they remove the tracks with the woman wailing over the top (it just doesn't suit the game well.  The instrumental tracks are far better!).  - It would also be nice if they allowed you to turn the permadeath mode on/off in the options.- Improve speed of the game (sounds like this i currently in planning)- Add the ability to fix aging weapons- More explanation of the current ailments (although currently this can be found on their wiki - search google for 'Moodles')- I look forward to NPC additions and I hope you can use them for fighting or carrying more items.- Add items like carts you could build to transport lots of items long distances (i.e. if movig out to a country retreat).- Improve the perk system.  It'd be nice to add a few positive perks without having to add negative ones (a lot of which are quite severely impacting).

content:
er 8, 2013
Early Access Review
								First, try the demo. Did you like it? If so, then I suggest you consider the following things about Project Zomboid:1. This game is an "Early Access Game" that is under development and is not a finished product.2. Many parts of the game (survivors, fire, parts of the map) are a part of that unfinished product.3. The game is playable, but overall, does not offer much in the way of varied play style and things to do within the PZ world.4. The devs are promising that multiplayer will one day be a factor of gameplay, but it IS NOT currently in the game.5. This is a very, very bare bones sandbox, zombie survival game, but it is still enjoyable and playable!

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
, 2014
Early Access Review
								I don't normally review games, but Project Zomboid is an exceptional game. Even in it's early stages, the amount of things do to  in order to survive is incredible. It pay attention to things most games miss like the power or water cutting off. The Dev's are very vocal on the forums and are quick to respond to bugs etc. They are friendly and easy to approach if you have an idea or question. The multiplayer, even at this stage is incredibly fun as a group of you work together to try and salvage tins of food and make a stand in the bleak apocalypse. Get this game and get your friends to get it too.EDITSince my last review this game has come along leaps and bounds. The aiming system has had an overhaul, making the shooting on the game more sensible and feeling right for the kind of game it is. The stamina system has been implemented so you can no longer run cross map without even breaking a sweat. Now you have to decided whether you have the energy to take those 10 zombies blocking your way, or try to get past them. The medical system has been implemented, meaning even climbing through a broken window could leave you injured. The variety of injuries and appropriate treatments has added an extra depth to the game, which is always welcome. Falling from heights now causes fractures, limiting movement speed until a splint is on the wound and a few days of rest have passed. (Hope you have a lot of skill books to pass the time!)The erosion feature means that after a certain time has passed, the world will change. Roots and weeds will sprout through the highway, football fields will start to grow small trees, and the buildings you loot will become cracked and weatherworn. Combine this with an ever expanding map, new skills for survival such as Trapping, Foraging and a way to preserve certain foods, and the much anticipated NPC's (no ETA's!)In short, this game remains one of the best I have played in a very long time, and i have spent many many more hours than my steam profile shows. Whenever the chance arises, i buy a copy of this game for my friends and they get immediately sucked into the game. Buy a copy, or buy a 4 pack, dish a few out to your friends, and try to start a colony in the apocalypse that is Project Zomboid.

content:
5, 2014
Early Access Review
								This will be a bit long, so just bear with me.A truly great game. Rather unique and open-world. There are hardly any restrictions in the game, although you might want to keep your head clear of such reckless thoughts in this survival game, or else you'll likely get killed early-on. The longest I've survived was 11 days, which I still feel quite swell of. As others have said, PZ isn't just an average zombie game that gives you a shot-gun and has you blowing zombie brains all over with no actual back-story (Did I mention that?), it's an excellent zombie game that gives you choices and has your heart pacing to run from that monger zombie pack... That's every-where. I also have another unique thing to say.YOU CAN OPEN EVERY SINGLE DOOR IN THE GAME! VERY few games have this ability. Skyrim, Oblivion, Minecraft... And PZ are the only games I've ever seen like this. GTA 5/4/3/2/1, Watch Dogs, Brink, and a bunch of other still-cool games haven't implemented this. Not only can you open every door in the game, but you can barricade every door in the game, break down every door in the game, and look through every door in the game (As long as it has a window.)ALSO! Another unique feature! The entire damn thing is pre-loaded! While you're waiting a possibly grueling 5-10 minutes, you don't realize that you dun have to wait for any more loading! Well, except for a second or two as the map loads. No long pauses between frikkin' opening doors, no quick loads between 6-week-long ship rides, PZ never loads again (Save for the occasional quick map load.) I've never seen these two, simultaneously, oh wait Minecraft. Never mind.Now, lemme cover some of the "features" this game says it has.Sandbox zombie survival game. ---- No lie here. You can do a very many of things that allow this to be true. Check.Full line of sight system and real-time lighting, sound and visibility mechanics. Hide in the shadows, keep quiet and keep the lights off at night, or at least hang sheets over the windows. ---- Lol yup. They didn't just implement a quick attention system where, if you come with-in a certain range, they 'see' you. No matter what. If you're sneaking, zombies will likely not detect you if they're more than 3 meters away. If you sneak up on a zombie trying to burglarize a posh house and steal it's meaty, succulent, intelligient riches, it won't likely notice you until you're fondling it, if you have the Graceful ability. Check.Vast and growing map (loosely based on a real world location) for you to explore, loot and set up your fortress. Check out Blindcoder‚Äôs map project: http://pzmap.crash-override.net/ ---- Well, maybe. I haven't explored all coners of either map, although it didn't take long before I hit the ocean, and couldn't swim. NOOOO!!! Now I'll never earn my Blue Ribbon for Best Swimmer! Bah. No check.Use tools and items to craft weapons, barricade and cook. You can even build zombie proof forts by chopping trees, sawing wood and scavenging supplies. ---- Yes. Check, check, check, check, check, oh wait, really? Check. Scavenging for supplies is simply *Italicize*Essential with a capital "E"*italicize* during the early part of the game. Later on, you can grow your own crops, but it'll likely take a little while before you can successfully build/find a secure, efficient, and sufficient garden/farm. If you don't, you'll die with-in the first hour. Check.Deal with depression, boredom, hunger, thirst and illness while trying to survive. ---- I have actually encountered all of these during my play time. And, I may be speaking out of my ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, but they seemed to have an excellent system of seeing your character's needs. Say they've been damaged. You/They don't know exactly how much damage they've taken, nerve bundle for muscle tissue (Which is ridiculous. Do you know exactly how many veins/arteries have been punctured when you're shot in the arm? Yes? Well you too.), but you have an icon that gives you a generalization of how much they have. Not too precise, not too broad. Check.Day turns to night. The electricity falters. Hordes migrate. Winter draws in. Society is in freefall. Day turns to night with-in a reasonable time allotation (You can alter this in Sandbox mode.) I haven't actually first-handedly experienced the electricity being cut off, but then again, I've only survived for eleven days at max.  Hordes migrate. I dunno, maybe. Winter draws in. Again, only eleven days. Society is in free-fall. Aye. Possibly check, not sure.Farming, trapping, fishing, carpentry, character customization, skills and perks that develop based on what you do in-game. Check. 'Nuff said.Hundreds of zombies with swarm mechanics and in-depth visual and hearing systems. Correct. They will group with each other in close packs if you accumulate enough. And if you have moderate-sized pack even, don't run. Hide. You can't run, but you can hide. (See what I did there?) Now trust me, you want a rather large sized house, break in through the window, lock your-self in the top floor, stay quiet for a good day, and hope for the best. Check.Proper zombies that don‚Äôt run. (Unless you tell them to in the sandbox menu). Check. You can alter the speed of the zombies in Sandbox mode, but normally they max their speed out at a solid jog.A ton of amazing atmospheric music tracks by the prodigy that is Zach Beever. Ohmigosh, yas. Zach made tracks that can make you scared, sad, bad-‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, excited, and maybe even... Happy?(?) I dunno, but check.Instant action ‚ÄòLast Stand‚Äô mode, on top of our Sandbox and Survival mode. I dunno, haven't played Last Stand.Full, open and powerful Lua modding support. I'll just say "Check" for now.Online multiplayer survival with persistent player run servers. Yes. Check. Multiple player-created servers, but they seem to be a bit of a pain to enter.Over-all, horribly great game. It's addictive, yet it's the kind of addiction that you love to hate. In the right way. Also, another thing. You can-not save in the game. Well, when you log off, your progress is saved, but if you die, you die. You have to start all over again. 'Course, you can spawn a brand-new character near your last character's death place.9/10.Although, I still do have a few suggestions.1. In Sandbox mode, you should certainly be able to modify your character far beyond just the Survival perk pick. You should be able to alter their speed, strength, biological defenses, physcial defenses, mental defenses, and their ability to survive with/with-out certain things/mental states.2. You should be able to add as many survivors as wished in Sand-box mode.3. I kind of think the perk pick in Survivl should be a bit more lenient.4. This game should become big. Like, WoW-big.

Its a hard game to get a hold of, there is no tutorial to tell you how to fight or do anything. There is no way you can ‚Äúwin‚Äù the game on the loading screen it tells you ‚ÄúThis Is How You Die.‚Äù The only this in the game are zombies and you. They are close to finishing the NPC. When they add them I will start playing again but for now its gotten a little boring but I still recommend this game if you want a hard game to play. BUY THIS

content:
24, 2014
Early Access Review
								Project Zomboid is Incredibly fun!! If you want to experience a Zombie Apocalypse from the comfort of your own home, then this is the game for you! The Isometric style graphcs give the game a unique style and with great realism, Music, Multiplayer and an awesome mascot (Spiffo The Raccoon), this game is hard not to want tp play.If You havent heard of this game before and are curious as to what its about, then i fully recomend you get the game! Pleas be aware though, this game is still in active development and in purchasing the game you are willing to put up with bugs and glitches.Also if you are worried about future updates and the dreaded thought of having to pay each time an update is released, have no fear as all upcoming updates are free once the game is purchased meaning that you will get the finished game too (When it is released of course)So yeah, I cannot reccomend this game any more than I already have. It's definitely worth the buy and so I strongly urge that you try it out!!! =D

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
y 27, 2014
Early Access Review
								A zombie survival game that truly simulates a real zombie apocalypse without being mundane like other games. Pros-Hunger and thirst system that is deeper than most (Calories and fats)-Smart AI-Meaningful updates-Weekly Devblogs -Working multiplayer-Big variety of foods-Intricate food system-Deep character creation-Nice soundtrack-World is filled with lots of things to interact with (Trees to harvest for wood, foraging in the forest for berries, etc.)-Lots of things to do (Barricade safehouse, kill zombies to reduce the risk of an attack)Cons-Some items don't have a dedicated model, but they are already working on it for the next update-No npcs yet, since they would complete the game. (They are also working on this as well)-No cars yet (This as well)Overall this is my all time favorite zombie game. This game actually gives you loads of choices on how to survive. You actually need to secure a safehouse and then make sure zombies or bandits can't break in. You actually need to make sure your food is in a safe place or else it will rot. There are lots of things that relate to real life which is what makes this game so fun.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
er 30, 2013
Early Access Review
								This is a great game, especially considering that its still in Alpha!  There are still a lot of bugs and it runs slowly and crashes at times but it is reletively playable in it's current state. As long as you are prepared to cope with these I'd deffinitely recommend buying this game in Alpha or at least trying out the demo if you're unsure.Some areas I hope they work on or prioritise in future releases/fixes;- Improve controls and sneaking machanic (currently sneaking doesn't seem to work well).  It would be great to be able to hide as well (maybe in some containers like bins or wardrobes).- It would be nice to see even more weapons, features and items you can create in later releases.- While most of the music is excellent I also hope they remove the tracks with the woman wailing over the top (it just doesn't suit the game well.  The instrumental tracks are far better!).  - It would also be nice if they allowed you to turn the permadeath mode on/off in the options.- Improve speed of the game (sounds like this i currently in planning)- Add the ability to fix aging weapons- More explanation of the current ailments (although currently this can be found on their wiki - search google for 'Moodles')- I look forward to NPC additions and I hope you can use them for fighting or carrying more items.- Add items like carts you could build to transport lots of items long distances (i.e. if movig out to a country retreat).- Improve the perk system.  It'd be nice to add a few positive perks without having to add negative ones (a lot of which are quite severely impacting).

content:
14, 2015
Early Access Review
								Zombie apocalypse survival sim at it's finest. The game is still in early acces but every addition to it has been nothing but amazing. You have to scavenge around abandoned buildings for supplies to survive off and if you decide to, build your own fort in the midst of the zombie apocalypse. Incredibly immersive with its wound and crafting system that allow you to build things like spiked baseball bats and sawn-off shotguns. Despite it not really being a horror game exactly it still manages to get a good jump out of you when you're investigating houses and some zombie decided to hide in a corner you can't see it. The community of developers does an incredible job of rolling out updates and keeping the fanbase informed and there's even a modding communiy. Just get this game.

content:
4, 2015
Early Access Review
								This is by far one of my most favorite games to date! It blends the minutia of management of supplies with the frantic running, scavenging and fighting of a great action game.  It has fun, believable crafting and RPG elements, with the ability to really customize your experience. You can modify the difficulty in various ways from rarity of spawns, type or speed of zombies, what kind of weather, how long the day is, etc.  Also, this game is amazingly fun and easy to modify. As a modder myself, I can attest, with a little trial and error you can get the hang of the lua coding fairly easily. The modding and forum community is over at the Indie Stone forums is fantastic, there are incredible mods already (some of which the dev have fully implemented in the game like the Erosion mod). On that same note, the Devs are responsive and willing to take and respond to criticism/suggestions. Also, there are weekly progress updates so you don't have to worry about the game being abandoned by the devs.So, moral of the story, BUY THIS GAME. I have played many other zombie games (which I loved) like Left 4 Dead, State of Decay, etc. but this one tops the list by a long shot.

content:
y 8, 2015
Early Access Review
								Amazing game. If u liked the feel of the old school Ultima Online...Its like that...with zombies. lolLots of Depth. Tons to do ( or more like worry bout) Infections, water, medical problems, food, bandits, supplies, shelter, and oh ya... Zombies.Multiplayer is a blast. Base Building is fun!Zombies hide in houses and behind doors and in bathrooms. So u gotta clear a house throughly before bedding down! Nerve Wracking. Worth every penny. The developers are eager and involved. They release patches almost weekly.Vehicles are planned very soon and so are intelligent AI NPCS!Only con I have about the game is the night time in houses are verrrry dark ( like they should be ) But I just wish they had a gamma or brightness slider.Game is kinda intimidating at first because of the meticulousness of the controls and abilities. The developers are really sticklers for the details! (which i like ) But that also means theres a bit of learning curve to over come first. I suggest maybe watching youtube videos / tutorials to help get started. But after you learn the keys....Its no problem!BUY IT!

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
31, 2014
Early Access Review
								We all come across a game which seems promising but once you purchase it, its the complete different. Sometimes we purchase games that are fun, but after hours of playing you loose your feel for the game. We sometimes purchase games that are hard to run without a beefy computer. Those are some of the most painful ways a passionate gamer experiences more than just once. If you do read the reviews and do your research on that game then you might feel comfident that the game is worth the purchase and you hope it won't get dry after the first week of owning the game. If you're reading this review, congratulations!PROJECT ZOMBOIDThis game is very unique from the millions of apocalyptic games. First of all its a simulator, There aren't a lot of great simulators for the apocalypse. Well most of them aren't still in EARLY development, Most of them are released as they are and don't update as frequently and have new content, but Project Zomboid does. New patches release adding new mechanics, bug fixes, customization, and so much more thats just one of the greatest aspects of Project Zomboid.Once you launch Project Zomboid you're greeted with an amazing soundtrack. If you don't believe me launch it for yourself! At the main menu you're shown these catigories " Mods, Survival, Sandbox, Laststand " and in the background it shows a heartwarming illustration of what appears to be a man hugging his sick wife. In these catigories you can play Survival, Sandbox or Laststand.SURVIVAL. In survival you get to choose the two maps created so far, make your character and traits your character has and what their career was before the apocalypse struck.SANDBOX. In sandbox you get the choice to make the world how you'd like it to be. You can change the way zombies see, hear, and smell. You can change how often loot spawns, the season you start in, how long the water and electricity will shut off etc. . . LASTSTAND. In laststand you instantly spawn in a house with a crate carrying weapons to defend yourself. You takedown the hordes until they break in and take you down. There is a timer so you can see how long you survived which makes it fun to challenge yourself or brag to your friends!For the price Project Zomboid is right now I would call it a steal! 15 US dollars for a game as it is now plus all the updates and patches coming, this Indie game could definitly go for more. You can't beat the fact it goes on sale every now and then for even less!This is how you died.PROJECT ZOMBOID

content:
9, 2014
Early Access Review
								Opinion:Its a great game if you are the fan of a zombie survival genre. It has a steep learning curve which will get you killed in your early lives playing it. You ever wanted to setup a base at a Gas Station - now you can. You can establish a base anywhere from a self built hut in the forest to a diner off the freeway, some buildings of course are more practical for survival (houses,motels etc). Just remember you need a place with multiple exits and thats has the basic survival aspects. The game itself looks exremely good it doesn't need good graphics I personally feel that it would ruin the atmosphere. But the lighting and the vision effect is a nice touch to deepen the atmosphere. I'd say its a must buy - but TRY THE DEMO.As for multiplayer, its a great experience if you team up with friends. You have to learn how to cope when everywhere you loot has already been scavenged. I remember raiding a house with a kitchen knife and finding a group of dead people on the second floor in a closet. They were loaded with supplies - I just got lucky but Multiplayer doesn't summarise the game up in hole as its mostly a single player game and regardless on which mode you play on you'll always find it tense!Survival is key as you can make a character very skilled only to die from something as silly as eating off meat. So try to establish a base and get non perishable food at first, eat all the perishables early on. Try to get a farm setup and a water source, as you'll need it once the Water + Electricity runs out which is random (unless your in sandbox).Edit,Got a lot better recently with more content and more playability. Animations soon which'll change the gameplay completely.

content:
er 25, 2013
Early Access Review
								Probably one of the best survival games I've played, period. I've played it since the early days on Desura, and it's grown immensely since then. It's also one of a small number of Early Access games I'll actually endorse playing in an unfinished state.Yeah, it's another zombie game, but it's explored routes that other zombie survival games have barely even considered. Sleep, hunger, and thirst are something you have to watch for obviously, yes, but at the same time there's also fear, pain, depression, boredom, sickness, even temperature is taken into consideration. And everything will affect your character in some way.It has one of the most comprehensive damage systems I've ever seen. Rather than just "You've taken damage! Don't let your health hit 0!", there's more to it than that. Scratches, bites, fractures, burns, infections, and bleeding can occur in all of your limbs, requiring you to take appropriate action to treat. One time I had to barricade myself in a room to perform extensive treatment; I had a deep wound in my arm from climbing in through a broken window, complete with a glass shard stuck in my character's arm. I had to remove the glass shard with tweezers, disinfect the wound, stitch it, bandage it, and keep an eye on it in case the bandage became dirty. And while it wasn't necessary, I sterilized the bandage while I was at it. Healing is something that takes place over time- unlike other games where you heal instantaneously, you'll only get better if you take care of your injuries and rest. They can even become infected if you don't take proper care of them. It's a level of realism that I've legitimately never seen in another game, and I appreciate that they took the time to implement it.One thing I like is that zombies are actually a threat in this game; one or two might not be so bad if you're properly armed, but a horde busting down a door when you're in a tight hallway is beyond horrifying. You can't just be a super zombie slayer like Tallahassee from Zombieland or any character from The Walking Dead; you have to be careful, observant, and patient. Busting through a door without any regard to what may be on the other side could be harmless... or you could walk straight into a dozen zombies that have already swarmed you before you can react. And once a group of zombies has you, you're done for. GG. Been nice knowing you.Most of all though, Project Zomboid understands what it means to be a survival game. While there is multiplayer as well as single player, it's not just a PvP manhunt disguised as a surival game like DayZ. PvP does exist, but even if you are in multiplayer, more often than not you have other concerns as opposed to hunting down other players for their food (though it is possible.) It places PvE first and foremost- it's you against the world, and the world is full of dead things. And depression, and the lack of food, and houses with alarms to alert said dead things, and uncertainty, and many other things out to ruin your day and get you killed. PvP is merely an additional feature in multiplayer, and far from required.There's so many things I could go into about this game and why it's one of the best survival games out there. Best suggestion I can give is to play it for yourself. If you're a fan of survival games, this is probably one of the most intense survival games you'll find- good enough to rival Don't Starve [Together], and that's saying something, as Don't Starve is one of the best survival games on Steam.

content:
y 4, 2015
Early Access Review
								This game will show you an infinitely possible world in an unforgiving way that makes everything you do dangerous regardless of how long you've been alive.TL;DR: 9/10 - Best zombie survival sim out there today.Zomboid is the type of game that might take a little bit of getting used to if you haven't played something like pokemon. IT will get even harder to get used to if you haven't thought about survival situations in your life. The day I realized I loved Zomboid is when I decided to try and craft something, without knowing the recipe, a molotov cocktail. I drank a bottle of whiskey, and ripped up a sheet, I then tried pouring a bottle of whiskey on the sheet, it didn't work. A couple of game days later I came across a gas can, I substituted the whiskey for gas, and 'lo and behold a molotov was created. These are the kind of possibilities that will keep you coming back forever. Everything makes sense.There are no shortage of "oh ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• I better drink some bleach because I'm about to turn in to a zombie" moments, or "The house is filled with zombies, I'm stuck in a second floor bedroom, I'm going to have to risk breaking my legs jumping out the 2nd story window". The zombies are dangerous, they can and will kill you in some of the most miserable ways. Sometimes it is as simple as looking through the window before you break in to a house to prevent a surprise attack from a hole filled friend. Shooting a gun is always dangerous and rarely can you take on a horde on your own, oh yeah this game is multiplayer too...With so much content it is hard to believe a game beyond early access and with things like NPC's (really well done) and offline co-op on the way, there is an exciting future to zomboid.

I HAVE NEVER SEEN THIS DONE SO WELL EVER.I also really like the system for makeing your charcter the way the starting buffs/debuffs is really good and it is really big and well drawn out map(espicaly for a handmade map)

content:
ry 14, 2014
Early Access Review
								Have you ever seen the Walking Dead? Most of you have. Let me say, if you think you could survive better than some of the characters in the walking dead, this game is your challenge. You have to fight numerous zombies, I have yet to have a save where i have not killed one zombie. You have to scavenge through the city trying to be unoticed the mass amounts of hordes of zombies and find what little food there is left. Eventually the zombies will find your safehouse, so you need to make defenses. you need to barricade your windows, build walls, and maybe build more rooms and crates for storage. eventually, the city will run out of food, so you need to either get the supplies to go fishing, or trap mice and rats and make a campfire to cook them. This game is the real deal. This will test your survivability. This is your chance to prove you can do it. This is the end.---OLD REVIEW:If you like zombie games, and games that require a little bit of strategy and skill, this is the game for you. at first when i saw this game, and i admit, i thought it was stupid. My best friend had showed it to me, and my first thoughts were that its stupid. i watched him play it anyway because i like to give games a chance. as i saw all of the techniques he used, it started to change my mind a little bit.  then i saw that in this game, you can barricade windows, build walls and barrels to collect rain in for when the water goes out, and saw that you can even farm food and cook food like steak, chicken, and meat patties, my opinion completley changed. This, is probably the most realistic zombie game that i have ever seen and/or played. this game will very soonly have multiplayer and NPC's. I have played this for 25 hrs. on steam record and i am not even close to bored with it. I HIGHLY RECCOMEND THIS GAME.-UPDATE 12/7/2014i've had this game for almost a year now, and i am still very happy with my purchase. this game is slow paced, and i took about a 4 month break from it because i got some other games that i was interested in, and to be honest, i got bored of this game. after a few updates had come out for the game, including a multiplayer update, (which i play on public servers a lot) and some graphic changes, including 3D models that look amazing, FPS optimization, and the ability to see if things are in shelves (which sounds like nothing, but before everything looked empty even if you had like 24 items on it) i came back to this game yesterday, and put about 15 hours into it since. This game is very fun, especially if you get a nice safehouse running with reinforced walls and such. well, thanks for reading my review, if you have any questions, let me know by commenting, and i will do my best to respond ASAP! Have a good day, and i hope that if you choose to purchase this game, you get many hours out of it!

content:
er 27, 2013
Early Access Review
								I originally reviewed this game back in 2013, but the current state of reviews for it, have irritated me to no end. So, I have decided to update my review. Project Zomboid, is perhaps the single game that does 'zombie survival' right. It has atmosphere, character and most importantly, a dedicated team behind it. The survival aspect, your character needs to eat, drink and sleep. Deal with depression, boredom, panic and illness. All of this is on top of the obvious, dealing with the zombies. Whilst nearly everything in this game is customisable, from number of zombies, to their cognition, hearing and sight, to experience rate, custom maps and even how fruitful farming or foraging can be. The game has several presets, for different levels of gamers. With 'Survival' being the accepted norm. In this mode, zombie mortality rate is at something along the lines of 96% mortality rate from bites, and 25% from scratches. Now, this is only magnified, by the fact you can have literally hundreds, if not thousands of zombies on screen at once, should you have the settings set to do so. This game forces you to learn how to play and survive. It's not a casual 'I'll run around with a shotgun and take out hundreds of zombies at a time'. This is a survival game, truly. Without mods, your character starts as an 'average joe'. With no specific skill set, unless a career has been chosen. This game has one of the most well done trait/perk systems I have seen, since the original Fallout games. This gives a rich and rewarding feeling, to have survived long enough to learn how to build and operate machinery, houses and farms. It also gives a much larger sense of profound loss, when you finally succumb to anything in the world. From lack of food, to fever, to the hundreds of zombies that are attracted to sound and sight. This game is nothing short of a masterpiece, I love it, and 90% of the reviews agree with me. You can't go wrong with this game.This brings me nicely on to my next point, please don't be put off by the other recent reviews, slating the dev team behind this for 'slow updates'. They have gotten more abuse than I can comprehend, from this angle. They have continued to update and support this game to the best of their ability, for years. The dev team consists of only six people, up from four in previous years. In this time, they have updated the graphics - twice, adding in 3D models whereas it was a game consisting of sprites (Still an option you can revert to, in the game settings.) and then they quietly worked on double definition models, behind the scenes. They are currently working on an animation system, which has taken a while, granted, but will magnify the gameplay threefold. This game, is more than worth the price of admission. Do yourself a favour, and buy this amazing game, you really can't go wrong. TL;DR, This game is amazing. Buy it.

content:
ry 14, 2014
Early Access Review
								Have you ever seen the Walking Dead? Most of you have. Let me say, if you think you could survive better than some of the characters in the walking dead, this game is your challenge. You have to fight numerous zombies, I have yet to have a save where i have not killed one zombie. You have to scavenge through the city trying to be unoticed the mass amounts of hordes of zombies and find what little food there is left. Eventually the zombies will find your safehouse, so you need to make defenses. you need to barricade your windows, build walls, and maybe build more rooms and crates for storage. eventually, the city will run out of food, so you need to either get the supplies to go fishing, or trap mice and rats and make a campfire to cook them. This game is the real deal. This will test your survivability. This is your chance to prove you can do it. This is the end.---OLD REVIEW:If you like zombie games, and games that require a little bit of strategy and skill, this is the game for you. at first when i saw this game, and i admit, i thought it was stupid. My best friend had showed it to me, and my first thoughts were that its stupid. i watched him play it anyway because i like to give games a chance. as i saw all of the techniques he used, it started to change my mind a little bit.  then i saw that in this game, you can barricade windows, build walls and barrels to collect rain in for when the water goes out, and saw that you can even farm food and cook food like steak, chicken, and meat patties, my opinion completley changed. This, is probably the most realistic zombie game that i have ever seen and/or played. this game will very soonly have multiplayer and NPC's. I have played this for 25 hrs. on steam record and i am not even close to bored with it. I HIGHLY RECCOMEND THIS GAME.-UPDATE 12/7/2014i've had this game for almost a year now, and i am still very happy with my purchase. this game is slow paced, and i took about a 4 month break from it because i got some other games that i was interested in, and to be honest, i got bored of this game. after a few updates had come out for the game, including a multiplayer update, (which i play on public servers a lot) and some graphic changes, including 3D models that look amazing, FPS optimization, and the ability to see if things are in shelves (which sounds like nothing, but before everything looked empty even if you had like 24 items on it) i came back to this game yesterday, and put about 15 hours into it since. This game is very fun, especially if you get a nice safehouse running with reinforced walls and such. well, thanks for reading my review, if you have any questions, let me know by commenting, and i will do my best to respond ASAP! Have a good day, and i hope that if you choose to purchase this game, you get many hours out of it!

content:
23, 2014
Early Access Review
								Hey everyone... I'm a big fan of zombies and I heard about Project Zomboid on a website and it sounded really appealing to me. I figured after finding it on Steam I'd try out the demo.... after dodging some zombies , opening the door to a gun shop and being confronted with the first zombie I ever fought I was hooked... Since then I`ve bought the game and played it the last couple of days, and it`s amazing.... the zombies can be avoided if you remain unseen and unheard but if one sees you its best to fight him rather than run because although you can out-run them, you``ll have a horde following you if you do....There`s so much you can do in the game that I haven`t done yet, I plan on collecting supplies and building a base in the woods away from the city eventually... My only advice is to keep playing this game, practise different techniques until you find what works best for you, and if you find it too hard play it in Sandbox mode which allows you to set up the setting to low population zombies (which still is a lot), Etc.This game has so much to offer, you can honestly feel the experience of survival in this zombie apacolypse, and its not even the finished result yet, in my opinion it`s definitely stable enough to play, has multiplayer option and one day will have a lot more than it does now including hunting, driving and looting cars, etc.If you`re thinking about buying this game play the demo, and if you`re intrigued, buy it while it`s still early access, it`ll be worth a lot more in the future... its a good deal, you get updated everytime they add something even after buying the game, and it runs on low requirements computers as long as it has a decent graphics card, 1-2 gb ram and the hard drive space required, I definitely recommend it.

content:
er 29, 2013
Early Access Review
								UPDATED: 29/06/14I've come back to this game again recently after taking a 6-month break or so (I find this is the best way to enjoy Early Access games) and I feel like it's improved markedly since my last review.Project Zomboid is best described as 'DayZ meets classic Fallout' - if that's something that appeals to you (and it should!), then I can recommend this game wholeheartedly. In previous incarnations, the game was undeniably promising but very rough round the edges, meaning the absorbing battle against the environment and the monsters that inhabit it was punctuated with jarring bugs and glitches like falling through stairs, walking straight through walls and so on.Many of the more troublesome gremlins have been zapped, and while there are still a few that pop up from time to time, the game is a lot less likely to do something utterly bizarre, and a lot more likely to kill you with cold, hard logic and survival elements.The developers have handled the release fairly well, providing steady and worthwhile updates whilst continuing to listen to their community and prioritising the issues that matter most to the fans (stability and the addition of multiplayer). This has resulted in a game that I feel a lot more players would consider 'truly' playable and could sink many hours into, even in its current state.There IS still a long way to go - NPCs seem like they're still a way off, and it's odd to see entire towns almost perfectly modelled, but without a single car in sight - wrecked or otherwise. These things will no doubt be sorted in time - the developers have proven over the past 12 months on Steam that they are happy to take their time working on things until they're ready rather than risking adding things too early and bringing in a host of bugs and issues.Overall:Fun?: YesAny Game-Breaking Issues?: Not really game-breaking, but it's not finished.Worth the Price of Admission?: Yes. ============================================================================ORIGINAL REVIEW:First things first - I've been playing Project Zomboid since I first learned about it on Steam Greenlight way back when it was one of the flagship titles, so obviously the game-time in Steam doesn't really reflect that. Just for disclosure there. :)Anyway, onto the game, and the first question you're going to want to know is 'is it worth it?'And annoyingly, it's kind of difficult to answer right now. Let's get this out of the way right now - in its CURRENT STATE, Zomboid is bug-riddled and missing many key features. If you're buying it right now (November 2013), you need to understand that this is absolutely an Alpha - entire chunks of the game simply aren't there right now, in particular NPCs.It's also clunky to control, has a learning curve that's almost Dwarf Fortress-esque in its steepness, and occasionally difficult to navigate.But the one thing that keeps me coming back and that convinced me to part with my money in the first place is the potential. It's not the 'War Z' potential where the devs are making grand promises with absolutely no idea how on earth they're going to keep them - the basics are in there: the map is freaking enormous, and it's gloriously detailed. The zombie behaviour is excellent - individually they're not a threat, but make a loud noise or stumble into a horde and you're in a whole WORLD of trouble. The parts of the game that are complete show an attention to detail and that little spark of inspiration that give the player confidence that whatever's being promised/worked on is going to arrive, and when it does, it'll be awesome.So to conclude, although it's often banded about these days, it's more true than most in the case of Project Zomboid - when you hand over your ¬£9.99 (or regional equivalent, I guess!), you're buying the game it's GOING to be, not the game it is right now. If you're not convinced that this is a gamble worth taking, you might be better off waiting six months for the game to take a little more shape, but you should be aware that the price will likely creep up again slightly, as the developers have confirmed that they want to reward early adopters by offering it to them for less than 'full price', whatever that may end up being.Fun to Play?: YesAny Gamebreaking issues?: LotsWorth the admission price?: Depends on your patience.

content:
er 26, 2013
Early Access Review
								Project Zomboid: The true meaning of Zombie Survival. For WAY too long, companies has been making Zombie Shooters, and calling them Zombie "Survival" games. DayZ might be TRYING to bring the Zombie Survival up from the grave (Zombie pun, not intended) But the zombies...Well, they arent really a threat.Project Zomboid is something COMEPLETELY different though. In this game (Still in "early" development) You don't need to just make sure that you eat and drink. In this you need to make sure you: Don't get infected, Have a safe house, don't get robbed by other survivors (WIP), Don't get addicted to stuff like Cigarettes and Alchohol and MUCH much more.This game has a very interesting Combat system. I like it alot, but I still think it could be improved a little. For example, when "Sneaking" you need to hold down the same button as you need to when you get ready to attack. Therefore, I have many times accidentally swung at a door, instead of opening it.All in all, Its a GREAT game. Go check out the demo. 8/10

Game itself contains everything what you can expect from this genre: making a shelter, scavenging supplies, battling a huge numbers of zombies and progress of your character. And a little advice for newbies: when you find a shotgun, never shoot with it near any city (it¬¥s suicide).

content:
y 7
Early Access Review
								Now I know that I have very low hours in this game compared to most other people, but this is just a quick review for people unsure about this game being in early access to back up the reviews of other people.Before I get onto why I DON'T recommend this game, I'm going to tell you why I do. Confusing, I know, but despite my recommendation I do think that the game is a very fun game.The gameplay is very realistic and tense and you can really get into the role of your character. Being chased down by zombies and having to manage food, be careful you don't make noise, build up a relatively safe space if you choose to.. These things are really fun and deliver on that zombie survival fantasy. The skill system is another mechanic that I liked the sound of, but due to my limited experience with that I don't want to talk about it too much since I feel that I haven't used it enough to actually say whether it is a good addition or not. What I'm saying is, however, that if you come to this game looking for a realistic and customizable zombie survival game, that's what you're going to get. There's no smoke and mirrors here.Despite my hours, I played this a lot before it was actually on steam so I do know what I'm talking about. I really like this game but my problem is that. as others have said, after years and years of waiting, very little of substance has been added to the game. Believe me, I played this game back when it had much worse graphics, and honestly I felt like it had more going on back then. There's newer and better features, but it's weird. The game just felt like more was happening AROUND you, whereas now it feels woefully dead, and that wasn't a pun.I could only recommend this game to newcomers if they think that they could get a lot of time out of this or the multiplayer, but until they get a move on and actually begin to add something of substance such as NPCs or a campaign to follow, you'll just eventually find yourself getting bored once you've done everything, and doing everything won't take very long once you get the hang of the mechanics. Now, the problem is - and I'm going to be honest and unbiased as much as I can -  the developers share very little about the additions i talked about above. They outright refuse to mention NPCs, but the reaon that they have done this is that the community would complain whenever they were mentioned about how they weren't done yet. I can sympathize with this, as I have also made far smaller projects, usually for only a few people, and people complaining that things aren't done is not only upsetting but at times outright demotivating. I respect their decision to not talk about NPCs until they are close to release, but this decision has, unfortunately, meant that anyone following the game and hoping that one day the money they invested into the game at the very start will eventually result in something that they can continue playing because, as I said, once you've done everything... despite the game being very fun, there's just nothing to keep you playing.In short: Would I recommend this game in its current state? No, but it is a GOOD game. Will I recommend this game in the future? Almost certainly, provided that the features that were promised years ago do come out. And I still hold hope that they eventually will. If and when they do deliver on those features, I will update this review after I feel that I have played the game for long enough to accurately judge the game. I am only posting THIS review to inform potential buyers of what they are going to receive if they buy RIGHT NOW. If you don't like the game as it is now, don't buy it hoping that it will get better. I honestly can't tell you that it will after how long i've waited.

content:
er 26, 2013
Early Access Review
								Me and my girlfriend.She died three times in our last run, the third time, it was my fault.She had been in the bed for a week or so, recovering from a fever that fell upon her after she was scratched while scavenging. While watering her farm, I left the oven unattended, and it started a fire, quickly burning all our supplies, the house, me, her, and our hearts. I kept telling her she was going to make it, she burned alive in the end.This next run though, we started off great. We found a digital watch so now we can tell what time it is without looking at the sun, we found and moved a generator for when the electricity is cut off, and we have learned how to capitalize on our strengths and weaknesses. We know food will eventually run out, so we are trying to find fertilizer for the farm. On our latest scavenge, I asked if we could go past the Electronics Store, she agreed. We're usually a bit more vigilant, and we have an escape route etc, yet this time, after dodging a ton of zombies just to get to the store, when the alarm went off, we had no plan, and we just ran inside. We quickly checked for a way out on the other side, but that whole room was covered with windows, and the zombies are coming from every direction. With the siren still ringing, we dove into a bathroom in a hallway, knowing we will at least have enough water if the zombies 'decide' to siege us. On that note, we both have an apple and we can share one bowl of rice and vegetables. She wields a battered baseball bat, I'm wielding a worn out golfclub. This doesn't look good.- GAME PAUSED -She has to go to sleep irl. She says it is a good moment for a cliffhanger.Me and my girlfriend. 10/10

content:
er 31, 2016
Early Access Review
								Project Zomboid is a realistic, isometric sandbox survival game. In other words: A kick-‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, different twist on Zombie Survival that pitches you against zombies from the top of your tower, firing you shotgun and screaming bad Arnold quotes...The game is set in the 1980s, in 2 Kentucky towns and a fictional suburb complete with an eerily silent prison!Start by creating your character; you can build their skills and weaknesses and choose their profession. You could be a badass veteran who can't read, a handy carpenter, or a firefighter who smokes like a chimney! The possibilities are endless!Use your tools to make a nice fort, complete with a stolen generator, log walls tied by dead zombie clothes and some fairly shoddy looking metal walls. Soon, your water and electricity will run out. You will need to farm and forage to survive, and deal with the hordes that await you...

content:
20, 2014
Early Access Review
								Project Zomboid, What can I say.. I love it!This game was made to answer 1 and only 1 question, "What would you do in a zombie apocalyps"Youve spoken about this to your friends, asked the question and you always seem to be alive..But what would really happen. Well the answer is simple, Play this game and figure it out.In Project Zomboid your an average Joe thrown into the thick of a zombie take over, Survices are gone, Water and Power are only temporary, Food gets scarce.Project zomboid looks like a bad game at first glance but the beautiy of this game is jot in her looks, but her brain.The depth and detail put into this game is truly beautiful in itself eg. If you get cut on a peice of glass and your bleeding, you need to get the glass out if there is any lodged inside, disinfect it if you can, bandage it if you have some and if you dont, better rip your pants into rags and wrap it up or youll attract zombies and bleed out.Its a lot of fun to play alone and even more with a friend, and im not just saying that too, multiplayer is the best thing to happen in this game, it gets a lot harder and more enjoyable with someone else tagging along in local split screen and online.Plus for the price of the game its one of if not thee best game to get for your money and the devs are great guys and girls, there a small group but they have been dedicted to this game for a long time and regularly update the game and recently has steam workshop.So please. Cuddle your spiffo doll and eat a whole water melon because this game is hardcore as heck, if that suits your taste, you wont be dissapointed.

Early Access Review
								I was agoraphobic, so I decided that staying inside the house was my best option for survival. There was plenty of food, clothes, things to barricade the windows with, etc.. but good things don't last forever. All it took was one zombie to call the others. I ran upstairs as I heard the windows shattering behind me. I panicked and ran into the bathroom where I knew there was a window, but they found me. I could see them surrounding my house in herds. I didn't have much of a choice when they started to beat down the bathroom door, so I opened the window and jumped into the crowd. With a broken leg and the rain drenching my clothes, I limped away...

content:
y 16
Early Access Review
								I would compare Project Zomboid to another early access game: Day Z. Most people negative reviews say Zomboid is taking to long to get good updates but I must disagree. I tried it more than a year ago and I didn't enjoy it. It seemed too complicated, graphics looked kinda lame to me. I was in Day Z's hype. But Day Z is failing to improve as a game in general. They add items and broken mechanics every update. Zombies are still glitched and annoying and all that kill on sight got me bored.Zomboid, on the other hand, has developed a lot. It has a lot more immersion, zombies are quite smart - they see you, hear you and can smell if you're bleeding - and you can custom your experience to your liking in sandbox mode. I'm still not into multiplayer mode, still discovering its mechanics and I can tell you this game is HUGE. By the time I'm done with the vanilla, theres a gigantic mod to discover (Hydrocraft).Three weeks ago I tried Zomboid again and after half an hour of gameplay I decided to buy it. I can tell you, its worth every single cent of its price. Its a very complex game and one of the best things is building a safehouse just to find out its not as safe as you thought - then you have to drive away hordes of zombies away from the city. This is priceless.

Product received for free
Early Access Review
								First game: Couldn't figure out the controls to fight the zombies, got eaten right away.Second game:  Figured out how to fight but had to be on the run for 24 hours straight.  Hungry and exhausted, I was cornered and eaten.Third game:  Started getting the hang of things, killing zombies and setting up a safehouse.  Got into a fight with too many at a time, got bitten.  Managed to escape and limped back to my house, only to bleed out in my bedroom.Fourth game:  Spawned in a perfect, fenced in house at the edge of town and have been staying alive for almost a month now.  I've killed hundreds of zombies, fled from hordes drawn by a helicopter, and I've started learning carpentry to build more walls.  I've got to learn how to farm, but I don't know if I have enough time until winter.  To be continued.10/10 would recommend.

content:
ber 19, 2016
Early Access Review
								Gotta tell you, I really don't recommend this game at all unless you plan on taking advantage of the workshop.Character creation was pretty cool and in-depth but the rest of the game... not really appealing, and honestly really boring. I did like the health and damage system though it gets really stupid. like really ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing stupid. For example, everything needs to be bandaged or else you steadily lose health. This applies to everything, even minor injuries. Got a "scratch" well if you don't bandage it you will slowly lose health, possibly get it infected, and then die if you do anything. All on the same day. Have a bleeding scratch? Well that's going to bleed you out because this game is realistic. Wait... realistic??? How is that realistic whatsoever? How do you bleed out from a "scratch" given you don't have a clotting disorder? It makes no sense that minor injuries can kill you or drain your health. Where is the logic and reasoning behind this?Don't get me started on fires. I don't even know why it's implemented when it's broken. I mean that as in pretty much everything catches on fire. If you forget to turn the stove off, well eventually it's going to burn and start a fire... however there's a good chance it will keep spreading and spreading, even over concrete and the roads.So far, their progress updates have been an endless stream of excuses for not having animations done--which is also their excuse for not having more content out. It's ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing pathetic, their fanbase deserves better than this. Instead they receive a long obnoxious list of reasons why they can't* get animations working.*Correction* do their job right... although honestly this game isn't laggy and it's EAUntil they actually do finish animations, I would recommend that you not fund these developers... unless of course you plan on using the workshop mods. Content-wise, this game's development is going too slow atm.

content:
ry 28
Early Access Review
								A zombie survival game with base building and bar nursing, BUT unlike most of the offering this one has some legs. Zomboid is a game where the zombies are THE threat, not a PVP game in a zombie location. It‚Äôs single player modes are the core of the game, with online play as an viable option. A large and expanding / improving map, a realistic medical mechanic, and some really interesting systems which no other game has. The one thing i love about Zomboid is the number of options you have to customize the game, want fast zombies which run in small groups or large hordes of sluggish walkers. Weapons everywhere or should finding a golf club be the difference between life and death. The game is solid and is being updated ,although slowly, yes there are many works in progress which people are demanding but it‚Äôs still a great game in its current state.If nothing else put it on your wishlist.

You spend a lot of time cleaning and making your shoes look even more amazing, you go to the party and everyone runs away from you. - "The next party will be better" you say, and then you start to work on your shoes again... ignoring the fact that you are a big scaring ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing monster.-- end of short story --Analogy whit this gameThe monster: - super slow development pipeline- NPCs (long promised) - Vehicles (long promised)- broken multiplayer (needs a ton of work, bug fixes, features to even start to make sense)The shoes  (things that were already good enough or totally unnecessary):- nutrition system (really?)- metal crafting- ultra detailed over complicated health system- painting stuff (what the actual ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•)- communication with in game devices (solving a problem that is already solved by external better voip apps)- the list is really big ...For that reason I think the team behind this project lacks knowledge on basic software development principles, like prioritize work that delivers real value not nice-to-have small stuff.Stay away from this game until they start to deliver value with consistency.

content:
, 2016
Early Access Review
								So far this has been a very interesting game.There is things that should have been included, like npc/ other survivors. Bandits/ gangs. Vehicles that can be torched, looted/driven. If the right person sees the possibilites in this game, then he/she will be famous. Already there is so much things you can do in this game, and thanks to the bright minds in the modding community the list of doable things keeps growing everyday.I usually never buy a "early access" game, i dont like and i dont need the frustration, buuut i read this game was well worth owing it in its current state. Yes they were right, never before has it been so delightful to smash the empty head of my ever nagging neighbour. Everyday for ten years he has been around my door with his Jehovas witness propaganda when im watchin tv and having a beer. But yesterday i finally managed to get even, i grabbed the frying pan his wife gave me for christmas decades ago and smashed his head clean off his shoulders, The jebus propaganda flew everywhere, the walls were sprayed with blood. I went outside, noone to see, and noone yelling at me. Good! When i now walk down the street, everyone bow for me. Could it be because i am so nice and good and clean? Maybe- or could it be because i am carrying a bloody axe over my shoulder? Probably..This game is worth supporting, i only hope more additions keep coming. We want to see well detailed fires, crumbling buildings. Explosives- and drivable cars you can run over people or into structures. Now if you all excuse me, i have an appointment with some empty skulls drooling on my doorstepHave fun children And remember what your dad always told you every night when you were  a kid:  "Always keep you axe sharp and clean my son"

content:
4
Early Access Review
 Project Zomboid	 Pros: + Zombies+ Open World+ Updates+ Tons Of Looting+ Weapons+ Crafting, Building, Farming+ Mods+ Realistic. Food Expires. Health and Injures.+ Multiplayer Cons: - Complex, as in the way you do some of the things in the game are not like most games.- Inventory Management Review Have you ever watched a zombie movie and said "If I was in a zombie apocalypse I would survive." Well, time to put you to the test in Project Zomboid. You choose how you look and your skills and are placed in a world where the zombie apocalypse just happened (or has happened 6 months ago). You search houses for food, water, and anything that can be used to defend yourself. Build up your safe house as hordes of zombies wander around your world. Gather enough clean water to survive before the water and power shuts off. You are always on edge with this game, never knowing when a zombie is going to be around the next corner. This game is not for everyone though. It's quite complex and may be frustrating for a lot of people. If you like zombies and if you're dedicated enough to learn this game then you just found your dream game. Personally I am not a huge fan of the graphic style even though I knew it was going to be kind of retro style. If this game was mixed with The Long Dark then I would love it, but it's still a solid game. I can't wait for the final product! Suggested on sale. My First Multiplayer Experience Story I played Project Zomboid for about 25 hours and I felt ready to go to multiplayer for the first time. So I spawned into the world and started to search houses for items. Everything was already well looted and I couldn't find a single useful thing. I couldn't find a good weapon so I took a stick just in case. Sometime later a person who was well geared but had no pants on came up to me. The man said to me, "Okay listen, I don't have time for this. I just got blood on my pants when I killed a zombie so I need your pants." I said, ''No. Just take one from a house or something." For it was my pants that I did not want to give away. The man said, "No, I want your pants. It's blue and I haven't seen blue pants in a long time." The man then pulled a gun on me, which I instantly started to run away. I didn't get far as I was shot from behind and fell to the ground. As I was bleeding to death, the man took my pants and put them on and as he walked away he said "Should have given me your pants." The moral of the story is when someone tells you to give them your pants... you do it.This was Curated for PC Beta Gaming if you would like to follow us the link is below: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/PC-BetaG#curationIf you liked this review please give it a thumbs up. If you disliked the review leave comment and tell me why. Thank you for reading my review. content:
2, 2015
Early Access Review
								No maps to find where you are or to find one another, No means to link your party together. No way to protect your base properly with traps and such. These are my biggest complaints, the rest of the game is quite good. I hope to change my review once these things change in the game.You would think with all the ease of online access now a days in games setting up a multiplayer game that this game would follow suit. This game is unnecessarily complicated just to play online with friends if you get it to work at all!
